attributes.action: scrap the National Curriculam Tests (SATs) which pupils take at the ages of seven, eleven and fourteen.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: SATs just stress young children out just so that league tables can be created. These league table often do not reflect a school's true standards especially in schools which have a large number of children who speak English as a second language. SATs are also only done in the core acedemic subjects meaning that talented pupils who are better at non acedemic subjects can get a big knock to their confidence. I believe therefore that these pointless exams on children should be scrapped.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "scrap the National Curriculam Tests (SATs) which pupils take at the ages of seven, eleven and fourteen."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
